definition: lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct
moon/month/monthly/CL:個|个[ge4],輪|轮[lun2]
shy/ashamed/shame/bashful/variant of 饈|馐[xiu1]/delicacies
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua

sentences.english: The girl's beauty would put the flowers to shame.
sentences.chinese: 這女子真有沉魚落雁之容，閉月羞花之貌。

definition: lit. fish sink, goose alights (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. female beauty captivating even the birds and beasts
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful
to have bright eyes and white teeth
seductive appearance/fawning manner
source of calamity (esp. of women)
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
dainty
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
embroidered headband used as decoration by actors or in Hui ethnic group/to reward an actor with brocade headband
lit. as round as pearls and as smooth as jade (idiom)/fig. elegant and polished (of singing or writing)
lit. like raindrops on a pear blossom (idiom)/fig. tear-stained face of a beauty
clear as ice and clean as jade (idiom); spotless/irreproachable/incorruptible
carcass/naked body
old school/conservative faction
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
